replies.author: @NurseMJ986
replies.text: I was a Covid Nurse. I know it’s hard to believe if you have not seen how sick people were. Some of them still have long Covid symptoms to this day. I initially did not want the shot, but the whole hospital was full of covid patients. We were normally a post op unit and we had all covid patients who were every sick and should have been in ICU but ICU was full. We have 6 (30) unit beds in the hospital with different specialties normally but were all covid units during the surge. Not counting the critical care units and even PACU which was an overflow ICU at that time since surgeries were cancelled. It was like entering a war zone literally. The question I asked myself, should I go to war without ammunition? Knowing fully well a lot of patients have died including nurses? ( these were previously healthy patients, no co-morbidities), or do I take a chance not knowing if my body can take the exposure to the virus being in close close contact with these sick patients????

replies.author: @blackfeathercrafts
replies.text:
@@NurseMJ986 luckily I was working pediatric home care with heart transplant kids and my little patients didn’t get it. My wife however was in an MS research study. 2 PCA came to work and didn’t know they had Covid. This was in 2020 before the vaccine.

Half of the patients died and the University of Minnesota had to close the study.

Had I not just came home from work when I did, she would have collapsed and no one would have been there. This was 2 months after the infection. I’m glad I could get CPR going. Her recovery has been slow, and we both have long haulers.

I’m glad nurses like you were in the hospitals trying to save people. I wasn’t able to join you in that direct line of fire. I’m also glad you came out of the war zone. I hope you are well.

I’ve been an RN since 1996. I had never imagined anything like this.

replies.author: @sweetpie7919
replies.text:
My dead uncle coughed for more than a week. He said covid wasn't a big deal for a strong guy like him. If you only got sick for a week I am genuinely happy for you. But it hits everyone differently. For my dad it was like a bad flu for 3 days, then he was suddenly fine, it was kinda weird how he just snapped out of it. For my mom it was a month of hell because her fever wouldn't break, she kept passing out. She said it's the worst thing she's ever gone through and it made her very careful not to get sick again. Both my parents are really healthy, no health problems, don't smoke, only drink on holidays, very active.

I normally catch everything. I haven't gotten covid, no one in my house has. But we've all been vaccinated and we did the whole mask thing. It was kinda great how no got sick with anything for a good 3 years. What a nice break. But alas one of my kids got a cold and passed it to us all, oh well. It wasn't so bad. I feel like the break from being sick strengthened me. My body really needed the break.

replies.author: @ChristinaPhillips-kc5my
replies.text:
@@BillGraper Tylenol? It's still on shelves everywhere. You just have to not exceed the max dose on the bottle and not pop the max dose every day. It's meant for occasional pain. Not surprising that not using something as intended ends badly. Nothing is guaranteed and nothing is perfect, natural or less natural. Life is a game of risk management. Bodies are not identical enough to accurately predict what a specific individual's reaction to something will be. So you look at a bunch of people who did one thing and the same number of people that did the other and control for as many variables as possible and see which group has worse results. As it turns out, like with any other vaccine where there's less to react to that in a pathogen infection, getting the virus does more damage.

If you react to the virus like a bad cold, you won't react worse to the vaccine. Because both sets if symptoms are from your immune response to the same thing.

comments.author: @mickenziefriesen5871
comments.text: I work in healthcare in Canada and I do not recommend the shot. If you are healthy, have no preexisting conditions, don’t bother. I’ve met too many patients with amputations due to blood clots after receiving the shot.

replies.author: @theozzy4717
replies.text: What's the benefit of taking it?

replies.author: @mickenziefriesen5871
replies.text:
@@theozzy4717 (sorry this is long)
Short version: it’s each individuals choice, but I would say only benefit would be for individuals with pre-existing conditions, as it will lessen symptom severity if they catch it, which for those people, could be significant to keeping them healthy.

Long version: just like with other vaccines it is not a cure, nor does it stop the spread of a virus. It simply is used to lessen the symptoms of a virus if you do catch it. It doesn’t make someone more safe to be around, only helps that individuals chances of having a Severe reaction to the virus. Not lessens their chances of catching it. I would say if you are elderly, or have pre-existing conditions or autoimmune issues, then perhaps it has more benefits vs the risks. (If you have underlying lung issues your lungs might not be able to recover as well) However I don’t think it has much benefit when you look at the risks for individuals who are young (I’d say 50s and under) and healthy. If you’re older but have great health then again, it’s risk vs reward. Especially kids I don’t think they need to be getting them if they are healthy active kids. Natural immunity is always better than a man made solution, however some people can’t risk that due to (as said before) already existing health conditions.
It should always be up to an individuals personal choice, however they should also always know the risks and benefits. Unfortunately many of the risks and usually health guidelines that are supposed to be followed were scrapped in order to release a vaccine quickly. (Ex: miscarriage rates were public knowledge until, particularly in 3rd trimester, the rates started increasing, and suddenly they removed public access.) Which honestly makes me doubt motives behind such a vaccine.

you take it if you believe it will benefit you. No one should stop you, nor should anyone force you to get it. It is a personal bodily autonomy choice.

comments.author: @andrewtorrens7790
comments.text:
Soke problems I have with this:

1) they don't explain what exceptionally rare means

2) the study didn't establish a causal link and doesn't rule out confounding factors (e.g. there might be other health conditions, diet or environmental factors)

3) none of these types of reports ever provide context to the risk. For example, out of all the reported potential side effects any vaccine, only 1/2-2/3 are actually related. With COVID that's expected to be lower because of people being convinced that the vaccine will cause harm. But even if we assume all the reports are due to the vaccine, that still places the risk at approximately 1/60th the chance you'll be struck by a vehicle this year. And any risks from the vaccine are far less than the risks associated with catching COVID while unvaccinated.

comments.text: So when the polio vax was released it was done in conjunction with the AMA redefining polio.  They narrowed the definition of it to the extent that no one could diagnose any patient with polio.  This gave the impression that the vaccine cured polio because the number of polio diagnoses dropped precipitously.  People were still getting Gulianne Barré syndrome, Bell’s palsy and all the other stuff previously associated with polio but it wasn’t called polio.  This is like me saying I’m going to cure traffic with a snap of my fingers…wait…first, let’s redefine “traffic” as “congestion of any horse drawn conveyance”…*snap*…boom!  I just cured traffic.  Sure, you might be stuck in motor vehicular congestion but it’s not traffic.  When the guy who creates a vax testifies before congress that his product causes more cases of polio than polio (Dr Salk sometime in the ‘60’s?) you really need to question the motives behind the mandate.  It takes 5-10 years before a drug’s safety can truly be determined.  When Pfizer rolled this beauty out in a year…well…you have to ask some questions.  My dad and stepmom but got vaxed and my dad died shortly thereafter from cardiac complications while my stepmom had a TIA, then got Covid, then got her booster, the had a stroke, got Covid again and died.  As far as I’m concerned Pfizer took my parents from me and I hope that my stepmom isn’t at the gates when they try to get in because she’d allow them into heaven when they clearly deserve to be in Detroit.

comments.text: On the 25th may 2021, I had my first and only vaccine, after being pressurised by the government, doctors, scientists, friends, family and customers due to my job...so left arm was the target. Didn't feel the best the next day, could definitely tell that there was something weird in my body. A week and a half, 11 days later  I started to develop a problem with my left hand, progressively day by day getting worse, muscle loss, fiery hot pins and needles and joint pains, it got so bad I went to AE and they diagnosed me with carpal tunnel syndrome, a week later the exact same thing happened to my right hand, but my left wrist and forearm were starting to get it. Basically by the 21st of June virtually a month later things got so bad that I couldn't even lift  my arms up, it felt like I was being paralysed throughout both hands and arms. I got admitted to hospital, where they didn't have a clue what was happening to me, it took them two days and a few scans later. Then they drop this very rare auto immune disease diagnosis on me..dermatomyositis which is was that rare, that they didn't know much about it and there wasn't really a known cure for it, then they tell me I have a rare blood group. So the only thing that helped with the pain was steroids, quite a high dose, 3 and a bit years later and I'm on half a milligram a day now, aswell as strong immune suppressant medication. Both of my hands and wrists have never been the same since. My right hip is collapsing and I now have a blood clot in the same leg, which you apparently become more prone to with this disease. comments.text: I assume that this test is on the American Pfizer vac that 'strangely' is not used in Europe, why? Oh! side effects!  Who would guess?  For most folks under 40 who are generally healthy, actually getting covid presents little risks and there are effective treatments, this risk is even lower in children.  The risk of significant side effects is much higher in boys and young men so measuring the risk/reward balance, there is very little reason to give the vaccine to children or teens unless they have a significant side issue such a Asmah and that reason gets even smaller in boys and young men.  Then look at the benefits side, the vaccine does provide enhanced immunity to covid in most recipients for a limited time period, about two months, and drops off very rapidly after that.  For many people, it might actually be better to actually get Covid that in most cases is less significant than a case of the flu, since the natural immunity that produces is more effective and longer lasting than the vaccine immunity.  Older folks and others with compromised immunity systems probably should take the vaccine and mayB stay out of Walmarts and Movie theatres until the situation passes.

replies.author: @esecallum
replies.text:
What can we do if someone is practising medicine illegally?

When we receive information suggesting that an individual may be practising medicine without registration, we will investigate where possible and take appropriate action in line with The Medical Act 1983

Depending on the circumstances, we may:

advise the individual of the law
send cease and desist notices
make a referral to the police which may lead to prosecution, a criminal record and a substantial fine.

We can’t investigate practitioners who work in other healthcare professions, you would need to refer to the professions regulator.

replies.author: @esecallum
replies.text:
Employers or anyone who is forcing you get a jab are PRACTICING MEDICINE WITHOUT A LICENSE. you can sue them. Anyone harmed by a person practicing medicine without a license may sue for damages in civil court. Again, laws vary by state, but as a general proposition, a person practicing medicine without a license will be liable for just about any foreseeable injury that results from the misconduct

The lack of a license will raise a presumption that the care was negligent. In the context of a medical malpractice case, it can be powerful proof of medical negligence (by an individual or by a health care facility) if a once-licensed health care provider was in fact not credentialed to practice medicine at the time the patient was treated.

Finally, if a person is knowingly practicing medicine without a license, and a "patient" is injured as a result, that can be enough to justify punitive damages. A judge and jury might find that the unauthorized practice was so offensive that the offender could have to compensate the victim not just for the actual harm caused, but also to pay additional penalties for intentionally deceiving the victim. This is akin to what might happen in a civil fraud case.

Note how in health related pages there is always a DISCLAIMER saying to consult your own doctor and is not construed as medical advice.

Most vaccines can lead to risk of GBS. This isn't news.
For example, a study into the vaccine used during the 2009 swine flu outbreak found that for every million people who had the vaccination, there were fewer than 2 extra cases of Guillain-Barré syndrome.

And evidence suggests that you are far more likely to get Guillain-Barré syndrome from an infection, such as the flu, than the vaccine designed to prevent the infection, such as the flu jab.

replies.text:
The questions is a good one. For me part of the answer is that the effects are rare. The total data set has over 32,000,000 vaccinated (AZ and PFZ) people in it. The total neurological cases represent 0.039% of almost all the UK and Scotland vaccinations. Most of the cases are the normal background level (ie the occurrence of these diseases in times before the pandemic).
It is true that in AZ cases there is a statistically significant increase above background for some , however, the greatest number of neurological cases (this is clearly stated in the research but not in the broadcast) is in people who are not vaccinated. For one of the diseases (myasthenic disorder) the research found that unvaccinated people were 60 times more likely to suffer neurological consequences than vaccinated people.

@@iu2 A: If there’s a link between the vaccine and GB, it means that those who are vaccinated against COVID are statistically more likely to develop it than the general population. Besides that, data drawn from the sample in the study isn’t representative of the entire population of people who have been vaccinated globally. That sample is too small and not diverse enough, not to mention not randomized. That is unequivocally not how science works; you can’t use data from one population to draw conclusions about a larger, more inclusive population.

B: Many of us aren’t even anti-vaxxers. I will happily take the TDaP vaccine when my booster is due and have had all of my other shots as well.

With progress, this is always to be expected, especially considering the timeline, my problem primarily is taking the option away to not vaccinate.

For me, being that I have been exposed to covid and my children tested covid positive, and we had to isolate and quarantine for a little over a month despite not showing the symptoms, after that experience my perspective changed, and specific to this we decided at this time not to vaccinate, from not knowing to knowing warranted a relief.

That being said, since the virus stays with you for more or less three months, I have been cautious not to be around elderly, and always disclose that I have been directly exposed to Covid.

Being that it is two years almost I am suspicious that Covid is in our communities, so it is very possible any one of us can test Covid "Positive".

In general, a revolving door.

replies.author: @joshuachittun9109
replies.text:
@@sangel1215 "it is like me putting sunblock on so you dnt get sunburned"....

Intrigued, and considering the possibility that you may be covid positive and not know since the severity of symptoms vary, we should at least be tested before vaccinating.

After recently having to quarantine for a month, my children asymptomatic, one relieved and two my perspective changed.

I asked why am I not being hospitalized, or given any treatment or care, the explanation often, your symptoms not severe, not life threatening, and your children asymptomatic.

I inquired what does that mean, what should I do, and could I possibly get worst.

More or less their response, your antibodies have built a natural defense and as such you have a certain level of tolerance, so in their opinion, never does a patient get worst, usually repeat incidents less severe.

At this time I can not say how does that work with the constant new variants, and if it means the same for the child I am expecting, but what I am sure of, is our medical histories can differ, and clearly the severity of symptoms, that is is very probable to be covid positive and not know, which makes me suspicious that covid is in our communities, we just do not know since we do not test often.

And I am sympathetic for those who have had sever complications, a friend of mine died early on due to covid, so I have been rather careful.

But knowing whether you or are not is a relief, and it eases the decision you have to make

Now I do not like that the option is being removed to yay or nay, and for those who decide to not vaccinate, how they are criticized.

My children and I self quarantined for a little over a month, so it's not as if we do not consider the well being of others, but it was not easy and a struggle, and often trips to grocery had to be near midnight, and the children missed school, and the obvious no work...

In general, power corrupts...

replies.author: @poloska9471
replies.text:
Just to add to what everyone else here is saying, the leaders imposing mandates are the same exact people who publicly stated earlier this year that (slightly paraphrased but mostly quote) “mandates are not the responsibility of Federal gov”, “we cannot mandate vaccine because it is immoral”, “there won’t be any mandates, we can’t enforce them and it’s not right”, and Biden quoted: “no, I don’t think it should be mandated, we won’t be mandating the vaccine” when asked about it. There is a lot more where this came from, and these same exact people are now forcing mandates, literally the same ones who said it’s either immoral, not constitutional, not their job, they wouldn’t even try to do that, and mandates are not enforceable.

Just consider that. They quite literally lied. Like… didn’t even try to cover it up, straight up lied. Just like they did about the border issues and almost every single other thing they said.

On top of that to add insult to injury, Johnson vaccine is at a whopping 13% effectiveness, and Moderna and Pfizer are around 30 - 50% effective for only 3 months, after which it’s anyone’s best guess… and it’s decreasing daily because the dominant strain of Covid is now delta and it keeps changing… so literally, there is almost no point to getting vaccinated anymore because:

1. It doesn’t stop you from spreading the virus to others.
2. It has highly questionable effectiveness to start with at this point, and after a couple months it’s almost not effective at all, so the “won’t get seriously sick” argument goes out of the window.
3. Delta variant is now the dominant in U.S. by far, which the 3 vaccines don’t help against.
4. Very little is known about side effects of vaccine beyond 2 weeks time after the shot, as studies used for approving vaccine for emergency use only looked at very short time scale.
5. Studies now coming out about spike protein entering nucleus of cells and causing issues for cell’s ability to repair DNA, which in each cell is mutated close to 70,000 times per day and is fixed just as many… this spike specifically damages the DNA responsible for repair, and damaged DNA is the only reason why we age and get cancer.
6. Questionable mandates very late to the game when all of this is known. A speaker for the federal government was caught specifically saying that the mandates are “about compliance” when asked “what is the goal of these mandates?”.
7. Nobody holds any liability for anything that happens to a person who consumes the vaccines as any liability is signed away by patient when getting vaccine.
8. Other unknown risks that are now arguably speaking equivalent to the COVID virus itself… it’s like choosing between infecting yourself with the virus or infecting yourself with the virus in terms of risk… isn’t it better to just walk away from both options if at all possible?
9. If we are mandated to willingly sign away liability on a legally binding document and thus forced to expose ourselves to bodily risk, shouldn’t that be illegal or isn’t that illegal?

Now to elaborate on the point I made about risk… I am sure it is still “safer” to take the vaccine than get sick with the virus, but since the effectiveness of these vaccines has decreased almost completely, the risk is barely justified whatsoever… you cannot get this vaccine and take your mask off anymore. You cannot and should not, just because you have a vaccine feel “safe” from Covid because studies clearly show you’re not…

Now, I get to my point about mandates:

Why should we listen to the people who lied to our face about our health when our health is not in their interests and on the contrary their financial interests are for us to get sick and to make money off of our ailments, all while these people hold absolutely no liability whatsoever?

To me, that is enough to raise enough red flags 🚩, stop, think for a moment, and smash that NOPE button, just like discovering a large hairy spider in the closet.

replies.author: @laurakelly631
replies.text:
My actual personal experience: I got Covid while not vaccinated (it had not yet become available where I live). I am still dealing with incapacitating Long Covid symptoms at 10 months, unable to work. Meanwhile, the Delta came to my area and I watched as 14 people in my village died. These are real people, neighbors I have known and worked with for 25 years. Their families are in real mourning, nothing soothed by your self righteous proclamations. Now tell me, what are your qualifications to know wtf you are talking about?

I am so sick of pedantic ignorance putting others at risk.

replies.author: @restingbird263
replies.text: @@guitarkatie  Raw Thoughts V, by Chris Webby.

replies.author: @restingbird263
replies.text: @@laurakelly631 I'm sorry for sadness of your story.  I'm not pushing anything on anyone, I expect the same from my government, and the people around me.  I'm not here to live in fear.  If covid kills me, so be it.  If I fall off my couch and die, so be it.

replies.author: @laurakelly631
replies.text:
@@restingbird263 Hope you don't fall off your couch and die. Is there something dangerous on the floor next to your couch? Maybe move that. I am not suggesting living in fear. That is never a good choice. I am suggesting facing the reality of danger and take precautions to avoid death (your own and others') before you would otherwise have to leave. Loved usually care about that timing.

I was able to avoid reinfection when the Delta came through my village God. I had gotten vaccinated by then. I am very glad about that. Believe me...covid is something to avoid, even if you don't die. Long covid is a reality and no joke. I am saying that because I have it. I am at 10 months and really struggling manage daily tasks much less my business with this. I'm lucky to have help. Many people don't. It's easy to proclaim how you don't care or believe it is as serious as vaccine side effects... before you experience it and have to live with it. Then, not so much.

I know there are side effects for some with some of the vaccines. My sister has a history of pericarditis. She is in Australia. We researched carefully and knew which vaccine was linked to pericarditis and myocarditis so we knew what to do. She demanded to avoid the risky one and got one safer for her. She had it with no adverse effect. It is necessary to do the research...but from bonafide sources.

I'm glad you mention fear. There is a ton of disinformation now. This is what is causing the confusion and panic - fear. It is understandable given the situation to be cautious and concerned...for sure. But to me, it looks like those who are refusing the vaccine are the ones living in fear. My perspective.

Believing panic disinformation rather than calmly doing the correct research knowing how to discern and respect bonafide sources, is in fact living in fear. It is easier when in fear to just distrust all experts and jump on a bandwagon that tells you denial and avoidance is safer. It feels kind of good to believe it. Problem is, reality is just not so.

Anyway, I wish you luck. All the more as this progresses, there is no easy answer. We are all going to need it at this point. I will continue to enjoy life, not at all living in fear, but taking whatever logical measures to avoid an early death, my own and others'. I don't fear death (not that I invite it) It's that life and loved ones are precious.

replies.author: @arisgreek8697
replies.text: @@laurakelly631 hello. Can you please describe in detail what covid has caused you still till today?

replies.author: @laurakelly631
replies.text:
@@arisgreek8697 Thanks for asking. I can do that.
1...Neurological - memory, concentration (ex: on a bad day which is not uncommon, give me a list of 5 things to repeat, by the time I got to the third, I would not be able to recall the first one or the last two. No amount of effort would allow me to recall it. Everything has to be written down). The concentration required to fill out a form...forget it. Any glitch in some process of getting onto an online accountl for ex, like a password prob...forget it. I will not be able to sort it out. I used to create my own websites and was good at it. I would help my mother and sister sort out anything complicated by way of paperwork or online access or glitches requiring sustained concentration and trouble shooting.

1a....balance issues. My balance was perfect before covid. I never thought about it. Now I have to walk carefully and I hold on to things when I can. I often feel as if I might fall when I am walking and reach for the back of a chair, or a wall or tree instinctively.

2...Fatigue. I am not talking about 'I'm a little tired' as in normal aging. I mean in bed all day, weak and exhausted. Unable to sustain a conversation more then 30 minutes without having to stop and lay down..not sit down, lay down. The fatigue, when aggravated with forced exertion, gets worse and makes the brain fog worse. I have to pace myself carefully and I do that to maximize my functioning. Pretty much I sit up in bed and work from there slowly while running my small hotel on a computer and supervising my staff (thank Gd, already well trained). I have staff doing anything that requires actual energy and exertion. I used to be out in everyone's hair making sure things were done well and helping with the work as times. I enjoyed that. I am a bit of a perfectionist, making sure things were as they should be in the hotel. . Now I mostly trust my staff and let them do it all, only occasionally coming out to check on things.

No amount of sleep or resting changes this fatigue. There is no restorative rest. For those who say, movement and exercise will restore energy, you don't get it. There is something called 'Exertion Fatigue' with this. Exertion makes it far worse.Believe me, I have tried. At one point I set an alarm with the intention of walking around my garden 5 minutes every hour with the idea of rebuilding energy. I really had to rest after each 5 minutes. I was able to do this one day, two days (adding up to 20 minutes each day and I was hopeful. Then I was blasted for days following that, much worse than before.

3...pain...During the acute phase (about 3 months) the pain I had in my lungs and left kidney was so sharp I could at times not move at all in m y bed. I would cry forcing myself to move sufficiently to get up to go to the bathroom. I was prescribed strong anti-inflammatory. It has improved a lot since then. But I still am taking the same strong anti-inflammatory at ten months. I ran out twice. Within 24 hours, the pain in areas of my lungs and heart, across the back and in the left kidney resumed. Not as bad, but noticeable to slow me down, drain my energy more and make me miserable overall. There is also an overall body inflammation pain. It feels as if my skin were burning, stinging. While I am taking the anti-inflammatory, I can ignore it. If I stop that, I cannot ignore it. Pain, even the kind that is chronic and invisible to others, drains your life energy.Anyone who deals with chronic pain knows this. It affects everything. I can manage it with the meds. But what kind of side effects will I be dealing with in long term use of these steroidal drugs? Possibly worse than most of the negative vaccine side effects that do occur, to be blunt and ironic.

4...difficulty with getting full breath upon any exertion, still varying blood oxygenation levels. If I go up the stairs to the second floor of my place (something I avoid doing), I have to stop talking and sit due to not being able to breath fully. I must sit and breath deeply to recover my breathing. Same is true at ties even without climbing stairs, but just engaging in too long animated conversation - talking and laughing especially - over 30 minutes and I feel it. I have to leave the gathering to lay down and rest. There are also times when this gets worse for no reason. even when I am just in my sitting with my legs outstretched position, while on the computer quietly on my bed... my usual position. . There are even still times when I wake in the middle of the night and feel difficulty getting a full breath, have to sit up and forcibly get deep breaths. It's an awful feeling. I keep a blood oxymeter. it usually stays between 94 and 97 but still drops to 91 on occasion During the worse acute period it was down to 87 and 89. I had a bronchial infection and narrowly avoided hospitalization, with constant coughing and difficulty breathing. It is far better now at 10 months, but still not close to normal with any normal exertion. Before covid, I did the shopping myself, spending 4 hours, carrying things, loading, walking through busy markets all over the town center...with pleasure. Now, I don't have the confidence to walk up the street. My good fortune is that I am in a position to send an employee to do that shopping. I miss it though, It was fun.

5...eye irritation.... This is not a debilitating symptom but I mention it as it is a symptom and seems to correlate with other symptoms being worse. My eyes get very irritated, itchy and red and watery. Conjunctivitis. This was very pronounced during the acute phase. It comes and goes now, but is always greater when I feel worse, getting extremely and noticeably red and irritated. At it's worst, it causes guests in the hotel to believe I am sick with something contagious so I take care to stay isolated.

As an aside, I have always been an active person, a dancer and an athlete all my life. As another aside, I am not overweight, do not have diabetes or heart condition. Even with the natural slowing down in recent years (67 now) I worked out with weights, danced several days a week, went kayaking, walking, ocean swimming. I take care of myself. My nature is to be active and I have been in good condition all my life, which allowed me to survive cancer (Non-Hodgkins lymphoma stage 3, with a rigorous regime of chemo and radiation and a 30% statistical survival rate and taking a number of years of my life for treatment and recovery.) I was seriously slowed down during cancer treatment for a time 30 yrs ago and I recovered well from that. I am no lightweight, I know how to be strong and persevere. If I say something is debilitating, it is.

I am - if very, very slowly - improving. I have to believe I will eventually recover. It would be seriously disheartening if I didn't believe that. I keep up on the research and access long covid support groups. These groups are a huge support. I intend to continue the pacing with the light exercise plan, only more gently. I do a little yoga (5 minutes now) and a little lifting of light weights...5-10 minutes every 2-3 days and the light walking I mentioned. I plan to work on carefully increasing these things as I am able. I meditate and eat very healthily. I miss walking and swimming in the ocean and kayaking the lagoon. All things I used to do. I do have hope that this will eventually get better and I am committed to doing what is necessary to assist in my recovery. I am so much more lucky than the 14 people in my village who have died after contracting covid.

I am also committed to telling this reality to people who seem to believe covid is not real, or is lightweight, or is not as dangerous as the vaccine...etc. It is too hard to read that kind of thing as I live what I am living. Reality check is called for and I can contribute to that telling my actual experience. How this came to become a political/identity issue is a terrible misstep in our society, with real life terrible consequences amidst confusion, distrust and disinformation. It is important to tell the reality first hand.

I am lucky that I have a situation with people helping me. I am semi retired and have a business I built which supports me and I have great help. I am able to rest. What do people do who must support themselves and a family at a job, take care of children etc?! How can they manage?! I cannot even imagine it. Add to that, that these symptoms are somewhat invisible and there is so much ignorance about it even among medical people at times. And then to have to hear people claim it isn't real, that it is a minor thing etc. is just too much.

If anyone is thinking that covid is a lightweight thing for anyone who gets it... I am here to tell you from my personal experience, you are so wrong. Apart from the deaths, there are untold numbers of people with long covid going into 4-18 months and beyond of what I am describing and worse - unable to work and live normally, support a family, do many of the things that bring joy. Imagine it...if it were you.

replies.author: @Habib_Osman
replies.text: @@wendywilson1736 Hi Wendy. I don't think the definition of "rare" changed recently. Rare means the same as "seldom". It means when something does not ordinarily occur. There is a certain albeit statistically tiny risk to taking the vaccine, however not taking the vaccine carries risks too. So, that makes for a great opportunity to compare the two approaches. There was a truly shocking viral video last week where a teenage girls smelling nerves were damaged, leading to all food smelling rotten. This was caused by covid. It is irrepairable damage. Quite scary! Taking the vaccine can also cause severe harm. So, we can say that both approaches carry potentially debillitating side-effects. Now we need to know which of the two is more likely to cause those severe side-effects. So let's say the vaccine is only 30% effective (in reality it is much more). Meaning the likelihood of getting covid is 30% lower. Even in this very conservative estimation, taking the vaccine is the much safer option. The one caveat is that long-term effects are unknown for the vaccine, although that can also be said about covid. All in all, I would conclude that taking the vaccine is the safer option.

replies.author: @Habib_Osman
replies.text: @@sandilranasinghe8699 Well, I cannot speak on how the entire world reports vaccine side-effects but in the case of the Netherlands, the numbers are reported in absolutes not percentages. So, we know for example that say 67 women have reported that they have experienced specific supposed side-effect X. The issue of use of the word "rare" seems very unscientific to me.. It might be the media that uses totally vague terms like those. At least in the Netherlands, we know the exact numbers and they are updated daily. The BIG problem though, as I alluded to earlier in this comment, is that those numbers include "experiences" "supposed" "reported". Which could mean anything from a simple sigh of discomfort- to a doctor making a detailed report of a specific finding. Those two aren't equal. Also, reported side-effects include effects that are almost certainly not vaccine related, but because that lack of relation cannot yet be explained they remain on the list. There are hugely important details missing in simple statistics! Ok. Lastly, I would like to say that everytime I have looked up actual proven vaccine related side-effects, the overwhelming majority of cases shared two details: 1. They happen  to people that are very close to death anyway (many different causes like age/auto-immune diseases/other illnesses) and 2. they are very, very rare. Think in the direction of 100/million (If we do not count simple, small side-effects like a sore arm). In the Netherlands, we have 3 confirmed deaths caused by vaccines today. All elderly persons.

replies.text: @@paul9156c That’s a great question. It’s actually a child’s question though because science is quite complex and doesn’t work in the black and white terms that your brain does. So there are a few factors at play. The first is that the vaccines were developed from the original virus sequence. Now two years into this ordeal the virus had mutated so there are multiple strains circulating making it not an exact match. It helps, but isn’t perfect. It’s very similar to how a flu vaccine works if you know anything about that. Every year they try to predict the strains that are circulating the most, the effectiveness of the shot is based on if their predictions are right. It’s never fully effective. Secondly, it depends on how someone mounts an immune response to the vaccine. Every body is different depending on their age, the medical conditions they have and the medication they take. Certain factors, like age, medical conditions ( like cancer) and prescription drugs can cause someone to be what’s called immunosuppressive meaning their immune system is suppressed in some way. When this happens, they don’t mount enough of a response. The third factor is viral dose, meaning how much of the virus you are exposed to. If you are in line somewhere masked and another person is masked and has covid you might prevent enough of the viral particles from entering your respiratory passages. The ones that get though are then countered by your own immune system or if it advanced, then the vaccine kicks in. But eventually, there’s a dose that becomes too great and an infection takes root. When you do become “infected”, the antibodies from the shot gives you an edge in fighting it off, but you will test positive. Vaccinated people are afraid of unvaccinated people for several reasons 1.They are more likely to be careless and participate in behaviors that result in getting COVID. They also are likely to be unmasked, so if they do have covid, they are spreading it. 2. If you trace the cluster of an original infection it usually comes from someone unvaccinated. In a family, its the unvaccinated member that brings it home. They also are a problem because they get much sicker so they typically require friends and family to come help them and because these people are vaccianted, they often help. They get exposed to so much virus, that they become infected. If they had been vaxxed, it simply would not have been spread more. I have an unvaccinated friend that put her vaccianted father in the hospital this way. He was a high risk individual so in this case, the vaccine saved his life but you can see how she perpetuated the whole situation. If she had been vaxxed, she would not have been as sick and wouldn’t have needed his help. 3. When you consider the mentality of unvaccinated people, its actually quite scary. They believe in grandiose conspiracy theories, they refuse to listen to healthcare professionals, protect themselves and others in public, and continue to promote a pandemic we have the tools to end. This virus most likely infected a worker and then got out that way so I think it’s great you are healthy and all and do immune supplementing but I’ve personally seen covid destroy two perfectly healthy friends. Also, I know people that have had COVID multiple times so a prior infection particularly if it was a different variant will not cover you now. People have gotten COVID once, had mild symptoms, gotten it again and nearly died. All I am saying is please be careful. Speak to a doctor that you trust and talk to people in your community that you trust that have been vaccinated about their experience. The problem with your thinking, is more people are going to get sick and more people are going to die and the ones that do often think exactly like you. Covid is like a fire, you can say its not out there or it wont burn your house down but it eventually will- not making it a big deal doesn’t make it spare you. replies.text: @@beverleyhusbands2544 I’ve heard of that for sure. The first person I knew that got covid in my circle went bar hopping the weekend this was circulating first in march 2020. I’ve heard of everyone getting it in one family, I’ve known people where it was 2/3 got it or spouses were only 1 got it. A lot of it depends on viral dose. You could be giving someone a short car ride with the windows down and get it, you could sleep next to your spouse and not get it. It’s the same thing with getting sick. You can get it and have it mild, you could have it moderate, you could get it and be hospitalized, you could get it and die. Maybe you will be lucky, never adjust your life and never get it at all. Although with omicron I’m thinking that scenario is unlikely. As a Florida resident I can’t even tell you how many people I know this week with covid. It’s insane. We have trash on the lawn bc our garbage people are out sick. The pharmacies are riddled with sick people unmasked yelling they are COVID positive. I knew plenty of people who were unvaccinated and nearly died from this that were young and healthy. Also knew some that were obese and didn’t have bad cases. That’s the strange thing about this virus, you just never know.

@@somewhatsomething4882 It's good you are wearing a mask. There are no forced vaccinations. There are requirements of either vaccination or frequent testing and some private business require vaccination which is their right in a free society. Please remember that we have always accepted such restrictions in our civilizations for the protection of others such as wearing seat belts, child car seats, drivers license requirements, restrictions about who can work at certain jobs depending on certification etc. This is how society works.

To answer your question, 'Why...when they are protected with vaccines etc'. The vaccines are not 100% effective against infection as you probably have seen in the info. They vary from 68-95% in a changing situation. here are people who cannot be vaccinated due to compromised immune issues such as transplant patients. The vaccine resistance has put the entire population at more risk.

This is a fact The entire issue is possibly now out of date due to new variants. Slow vaccine rollout, mask resistance, together with government corruption in early failings to deal with this pandemic in every way, have already brought us to another level of risk.

Because of the slow rollout and so many refusing to wear masks or to be vaccinated, many variants have been able to form. We now face a worse situation with a new strain more contagious than Delta more deadly and also resistant to the vaccines. This has happened because we could not get cooperation via masking and vaccinations soon enough to stop the spread of the early versions.

We have done this to ourselves through misplaced panic, lack of understanding of science and intentional spread of misinformation.

Still people will not read the science so they can understand that. We are in a grave situation now, worse than before, due to panic, ignorance and corruption on high levels of government.

If this new variant spread takes off (likely as so many refuse precautions), temporarily not buying clothes in the shop of your choice will be least of your worries. Good luck.

I already got the virus, actually. Felt miserable for about 3-4 days, after that I can do normal activity as long as I don't exert myself and it's followed by around 2/3 weeks of the absence of smelling sense. Got it from my elder brother. Recovered after taking a lot of vitamins and supplements (gotta feed my immune system that fights hard for myself in my body).

If you're young, healthy, and realized it early, your chance of recovery is 99%. And despite sleeping in the same room as my mom, my sister and I never infected her as she kept her daily supplement and healthy habit. Feeling kinda iffy because it's mandated to get vaccinated nowadays if I want to do something like going to college.

Not saying the virus is not dangerous, though. My healthy and active aunt almost died. At one point, I thought we'd lose another family member after grandma (infection, not covid) died earlier this year to make up for not losing anything in 2020 (lost grandpa at 2018, my dad in 2019, and my grandma in early 2021), but thankfully she pulled through after weeks of horror.

If you research the prevalence of GBS and hemorrhagic stroke and crunch the numbers you will see the incidence of GBS following vaccination is less than 3 times the background rate, and the usual incidence of hemorrhagic stroke (normally a shade over 100,000 Americans out of 331 million, or one per 3310 Americans each year) dwarfs the one-time risk of one per 600,000 for the Pfizer vaccine.

As of now, the CDC reports about 221 million Americans have been vaccinated against COVID-19 with at least one dose. Numbers used are real but rounded for easy reading.
Starting on the day they got the vaccine, the recipients began dying. An average of about 4000 died on that first day, and another 7,400 the next day… day after day. 52,000 per week, 220,000 per month they died, and we were never told. None of the 220 million of them – not one – died on any of the days preceding the vaccine. All this is true – well, true enough.
Why? The average life expectancy in the USA is 78.54 years, but we will round it up to about 82 years or 30,000 days. In the cohort of 220 million, each selected the moment they got the vaccine, an average of about 7,400 would die of some cause or other on any given day. Older recipients increase the rate, but let's not get greedy.
Why did none of them die before getting the vaccine? We don’t vaccinate dead people.

@@Theonewhoneverlies478 if you think I believe ANYONE blindly then you either made assumptions about what I wrote, inferred incorrectly, or I wasn't clear enough.
I will say that too many times on here, if a person says one thing positive about a given subject, others take it and run with it to the extreme end.
I can say "vaccines should not be mandated" and I'll get someone ripping me to shreds about me not believing in vaccines or not caring if people die or other ridiculousness.
If I say we should wear masks, I'll get called a brainwashed leftist and accused of loving Big Pharma.
I don't think people can look at ONLY what's been said without assuming a million other things about it.
They're like dogs, red lining and so fixated on a target that the moment they can detect any movement at all from their "prey," they can't think of anything but attacking. They can't hear anything or see anything or think anything but "attack!"
But I bet any amount of money, if they were neighbors or coworkers, it would NEVER even come up let alone be something to fight about.
It's sickening to see, really, the way we CHOOSE to act when left to our own devices. Then we wonder why Big Brother comes in with all the laws restricting those choices.

@@Theonewhoneverlies478 no I don't think they should be mandated. Their effectiveness isn't good enough for a mandate, they haven't been out long enough to be proven safe enough for a mandate. That's considering ALL things, not JUST the two things I listed.
And frankly, if they didn't first try mandating masks (which DO reduce exposure to the virus and are also non-invasive) then they have no right to jump straight to a vaccine mandate, which is invasive and does not eliminate or reduce transmission or infection.
I do not think they are showing any more or less side effects than any other vaccine. It's always going to be about benefit vs. risk for each person.
Vaccines in general are life saving so I'm pro-vaccine (generally speaking.)
People who are compromised in some way should probably get it, but that's for their safety.

replies.author: @bigblue1762
replies.text:
As a doctors please call your physician or provider and thank them, I never told anyone that pain meds were safe. There is always risk, that is why this job I do is so difficult and everyone is different. I go to work to help people and yes science does sometimes change protocols, I know the media is not accurate on both sides. But we swear an oath to first do no harm and with our training and experience we make decisions on evidence based medicine. Ask you provider what that means. This forum is for watching entertainment or do it yourself projects

The internet is not a substitute for years of school residency and work experience.

We don’t go to work everyday and say who can I mistreat today….

Come on. And Covid. We health care professionals are exhausted and some are leaving because we are tired of talking to people who are not educated re medicine and especially reading and understanding scientific papers. And get this misinformation from unknown sources, pure opinion , and tell me they know more than me..

I have 14 icu patients unvaccinated 10 on vents.. half will die, all unvaccinated and ages 32 to 67. Unbelievable and unnecessary.
That is our health care today. It is like a mouse in a cage, just running on the wheel, no progress

The vaccine adds code to your DNA in the cells to manufacture spike proteins. That would be ok, if the spike protein was inert. But, it’s not.

Research now shows the spike protein is now associated with several major disease processes by creating autoimmune and blood pathology within your system. And, these side effects become exponentially more severe with EVERY BOOSTER.

The scary part is; it’s permenant. Your cells continue to release the spike protein for life.

This is not the case with natural immunity from a typical COVID 19 infection. Spike proteins are released but only for a limited time.

comments.author: @jesusloveyou3281
comments.text:
THEME: LET HIM TAKE YOUR BURDEN.

MEMORISE: The soul that sinneth, it shall die. The son shall not bear the iniquity of the father, neither shall the father bear the iniquity of the son: the righteousness of the righteous shall be upon him, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be upon him. Ezekiel 18:20

READ: Ezekiel 18:1-4.
1The word of the Lord came unto me again, saying,
2 What mean ye, that ye use this proverb concerning the land of Israel, saying, The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children's teeth are set on edge?
3 As I live, saith the Lord God, ye shall not have occasion any more to use this proverb in Israel.
4 Behold, all souls are mine; as the soul of the father, so also the soul of the son is mine: the soul that sinneth, it shall die.

MESSAGE:
The righteousness of God demands that the soul that commits sin would die as we see in our memory verse today. John 10:10 however gives us an alternative to sin and death:
“The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.”

When we accept Jesus Christ as our Lord and Savior, He saves us from the life of sin, and ultimately eternal death, blessing us with abundant life instead.

Another truth I want to share with us is that the righteousness of God does not allow an offender to be punished twice for one offense. Since Jesus Christ our Redeemer has suffered for our sins, we are discharged and acquitted. As long as you do not commit that sin again, once Jesus has forgiven you, your forgiveness is absolute.
“Surely he hath borne our griefs, and carried our sorrows: yet we did esteem him stricken, smitten of God, and afflicted. But he was wounded for our transgressions, he was bruised for our iniquities: the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and with his stripes we are healed.” Isaiah 53:4-5

Beloved, I am using this medium to appeal to you to come to Jesus Christ today and He will relieve you of your burden of sin. As a matter fact, the cross He carried before His crucifixion was for you and me. All you need to do is confess your sins and accept Jesus as your Savior and Lord. The Bible says if we say we have no sin, we deceive ourselves and there is no truth is us (1 John 1:8). We deny ourselves the privilege of the great Burden-Bearer if we refuse to come to Him and make Him the Lord of our lives. He must be your Lord and Savior.

I pray that the Almighty God will relieve you of every burden of sin and sorrow, in Jesus’ name.

PRAYER POINT:
Father, I bring my burden to You today in genuine repentance. Please forgive me and lift my burden today, in the mighty name of Jesus.

comments.author: @elizabethdjokovic2691
comments.text:
It's a shame that the companies that produce and market these vaccines are a law unto themselves and have succeeded in convincing politicians who act as representatives of the people that the jab was the only way forward.

The vaccine was in the pipeline long before the pandemic started but no trials were conducted on animals. The vaccine producers seized the opportunity to embark on a program to put billions into their coffers while everyone submitted to coercive tactics designed to get compliance.

They succeeded but not because everyone who got vaccinated were fully informed and were convinced it was the answer. They made sure they wouldn't lose all their profits by enforcing conditions and making everyone sign a waiver granting them immunity from responsibility for any harms arising out of the decision of people to get vaccinated.

And they succeeded. One country after another, has in desperation, followed the advice of the " experts" . They copied each other and improvised on the original blueprint for persuasion.

Vaccine passports indeed! Apartheid? Yes indeed.Exclision of people who refuse it. Fines for elderly people who refuse it in Greece. It's out of control. The fear generated by the media has made it worse than the disease itself. A high recovery rate for those who got it. Natural immunity for most who got it negating the requirement for vaccination. In some places forcing people to get jabbed anyway.
They used a very effective psychological ploy to get the desired result. Not only that,
they primed people to accept the idea that regular boosters would be needed to keep them protected.
People even accepted that the vaccines were not a guarantee of protection when more became known about its efficacy.
Many trust the vaccine makers and refuse to question their integrity. The government's worldwide have been forced to know tow to the corporation's. Shouldn't it have been the other way around?

There's a good reason why people have protested in great numbers on the streets
of the world's big cities. They are fearful of the future in the face of the attack on their freedom of choice. They are fearful of what will happen to their children if they are vaccinated. Fear is a great motivator.

On the one hand you have the unvaccinated fearful of the effects of the vaccines.

On the other hand you have the vaccinated fearful of what will happen if they refuse to be vaccinated.

Fear of dying. Fear of losing employment. Fear of being unable to see loved ones. Fear of not being able to travel, eat out, go to the movies, go to big sporting events. Fear of not being able to go about the ordinary activities of life one takes for granted.

There is so much fodder for discussion here, but that is not encouraged. Most people trust the professionals to do no harm.
Whether they deserve to be trusted is questionable.

comments.author: @Moving_Forward247
comments.text: God bless this reported but she should learn to pronounce hemorrhagic correctly.  Understandable that she didn't pronounce GBS correctly.  These numbers are small (30-60 people) out of 10 million.  Everything is about risk/benefit (obviously).  The risk of dying in a plane crash is 1 in 16 million.  I'm willing to fly with that risk.  GBS (Guillain Barre Syndrome) can occur after infections or vaccines (not just COVID vaccines)--basically if you introduce something to trigger the immune system sometimes the immune system will respond in a bad/overboard way and cause something like GBS rather than having a more focused response (eg just forming antibodies to the antigens in the vaccine).  I don't think this report should sway most people from getting vaccinated.  What I would say is: know Jesus--he's the only way to be safe for eternity.  And for vaccines: if you have a history of autoimmune disease think and pray about it more.  But I don't think these are really strong numbers to discourage vaccination for most folks.
